WHICH ARE ASSIGNED TO ALL FRESH SURFACE WATERS WITHIN THE FINGER LAKES DRAINAGE

Ont. 66-12 portion as described including Barge

Canal sections and P 366a

Seneca River, Barge Canal

The Seneca is one of the main rivers in the Oswego

River system draining an area of 5,000 square miles. It joins with the Oneida
to form the Oswego River at Three Rivers just north of Syracuse. The section
from Three Rivers to Bonta Bridge was covered in section
897.4. From Bonta Bridge which is
located 0.2 mile upstream from Skaneateles Creek and 30.0 miles upstream from

Three Rivers, approximately 1.1 miles north of the intersection of N.Y. Route
31 and Berry Hump Road to Village of Waterloo water treatment plant intake
located at the west edge of Village of Waterloo, 0.2 mile south of U. S. Route
20. H-13se H-13sw J-13nw J-12ne J-12nw
